speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on, anyway? [_glances at watch_] My God, I've got an appointment in twenty minutes.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ah, some weenie made a big stink so they've gotta clean the milk steamer every time they use it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_turning back_] Is was you, wasn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_haughtily_] Well, if requesting basic sanitary procedures makes me a weenie, then a weenie be I.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Frasier/Bulldog
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_glances at line_] Oh, God, Frasier, what stupid suggestion did you make this time?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice to see you, too, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Sorry.  I just spent two hours trying on jumbo formal wear for the SeaBea awards. _Roz holds up a garish, sequin-covered silver dress with a monstrous silver bow on the back._

speaker: Roz
text: [_smirk_] The best part was when the size two sales girl said I could use this again after my pregnancy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps you could... [_gestures_] cut off the bow, remove the sleeves, and, uh...

speaker: Bulldog
text: Stick a pole in it and go camping.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, if I'm gonna stick a pole some place....

speaker: Frasier
text: Children!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_reaching the counter_] Coffee to go.  Black.

speaker: Frasier
text: I, for one, am looking forward to the SeaBeas.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Why?  You're not gonna win.  They never give it to the emcee! Now me?  I'm a lock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're awfully cocky.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, if knowing I'm the best thing on the air makes me cocky, then cocky be I.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah. _While they are talking, a man walks in front of them to the left. He's wearing a dark baseball cap._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_ignoring him_] See?  You're not the only one who can talk classy.

speaker: Roz
text: [_confused_] How is that talking like Lassie?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's just move on, shall we? _Roz walks toward the side of the counter.  Frasier looks at the man who's just passed and then nudges Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering_] Roz!  That man, he's got a gun! _Indeed, the man has a gun in the front of his pants, and he seems to be trying to discreetly remove it.  Roz looks and gasps._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_overhearing_] He's got a gun! _Coffee goes flying.  Bulldog grabs Roz and pulls her away from the gunman, falling on the floor.  The gunman makes a run for it and makes it out of the cafe._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, are you all right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, uh.... _Bulldog stands up, dusting himself off.  He sees the gun on the ground and picks it up._

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog, I can't believe you did that! [_hugs him_] You saved me!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_confused_] Uh, I just did what anyone would've done.

speaker: Customer 1
text: You were so brave! [_kisses him on cheek_]

speaker: Customer 2
text: [_hugs him_] You're a hero!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, close enough. _They shake hands.  FADE OUT_ **BAD DOG** _Scene Two - Int. elevator at Elliot Bay Towers The elevator doors are closing._

speaker: Niles
text: [_o.s._] Excuse me, would you hold that, please? _The doors open to reveal Frasier.  Niles steps on elevator, wearing a grey billed cap that looks ridiculous on him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I was just on my way up to see you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what have we determined about your success with... impulse purchases?

speaker: Niles
text: Really?  The salesman thought I could pull it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: My suggestion exactly.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.  Fine. [_excitedly_] Frasier, ask me if I have news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I've got some news of my own.  In the cafe today - [_glances at Niles, who is glaring at him_] Oh, for God's sake. Niles, do you have news?

speaker: Niles
text: Indeed I do.  First of all, congratulations on your SeaBea nomination.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, congratulate me on mine!

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Niles
text: [_pulls out papers_] Well, if you'd bothered to look past your own name on the first page, you'd have found mine right after it on page... [_flips through pages_] fifteen.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reads_] "Best Performance By a Guest on an Information Show."

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it's for that spot I did on KJSB when I discussed the psychological effects of long-term inclement weather.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turning away, amused_] Ah, yes, yes, yes.... Thirty minutes of psychobabble all reducible to one phrase: "Rain, rain, go away." _The elevator doors open.  Niles follows Frasier to the door.  Frasier looks for his key._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm hardly surprised you feel the need to belittle my nomination.  In your mind, you're the success, the famous one. I'm just invisible.  That's not the way the rest of the world sees me. _Frasier opens the door.  Daphne and Martin rush up to him, ignoring Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: [_hugging Frasier_] Oh, Frasier, boy, am I glad to see you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thanks, guys, thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_also hugging him_] Doctor Crane, thank goodness you're home!

speaker: Niles
text: [_large, forced grin_] I'm also here!

speaker: Daphne
text: We heard what happened at the cafe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles, as I have tried to tell you, there was an attempted armed robbery today at the cafe.

speaker: Niles
text: Good heavens!  Was anyone hurt?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, thank goodness.  It all diffused rather quickly. Tempest in a tea pot, really. [_rubs Daphne's shoulders as he walks back to hang up his coat_] Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_walking to coat rack and removing trench coat_] Well, that's a relief!  On a more pleasant topic, this afternoon, I found out-

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, hold on a second. [_points at Martin and Daphne_] How did you two hear about it?

speaker: Daphne
text: On the news!

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, Bulldog really saved the day!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hanging coat, shocked_] They said that on the news?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, how he swept Roz out of the way and then threw his hot coffee on the gunman!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not how it happened at all!  Why would he say such a thing?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it was drizzling today, and people act strangely when it rains, as I pointed out in my SeaBea-nominated-

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, then what did happen? _FLASHBACK TO: the scene in the caf e.  It plays out step by step as Frasier explains it. _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] Well, we were all standing at the counter, when I noticed a man with a gun.  I warned Roz.  Bulldog saw a different man reaching for his wallet, and thought he was the gunman.  That's when he grabbed Roz and held her in front of him as a human shield!  But as he did that, he accidentally knocked his coffee onto the actual gunman, burning his hand, causing him to drop his weapon and run out!

speaker: Daphne
text: And no one else saw that happen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, apparently not.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, I can't believe Bulldog'd use Roz like that!

speaker: Niles
text: Why didn't you say anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was just so relieved everyone was all right at first! I suppose it did irk me when everyone was praising him, and the owner of the cafe promised him a lifetime supply of muffins! [_pause_] Well, I never thought it'd go this far. I never thought I'd hear it on the news! [_walks over to pour himself a sherry_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I wonder how much that would be, a lifetime supply of muffins?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm certainly not going to let Bulldog get away with this!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_folding underwear_] I don't think I've ever seen Bulldog eat a muffin.  A lifetime supply would be wasted on him!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going to tell him I saw exactly what happened!

speaker: Daphne
text: Now me, I could eat a muffin a day, some days even two knowing they'd be free.  So that'd be... [_thinking hard_] ten a week, fifty-two weeks a year, for at least another... forty years, which works out to.... [_looks aghast at the Cranes_] Twenty thousand muffins!  My life suddenly seems long, measured in muffins. _FADE TO:  Scene Three - int Frasier's booth at the station. Frasier is concluding his show._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's all the time we have for today.  Good afternoon, Seattle, and good mental health. [_off-air_] Roz, did you see Bulldog come in? _Roz enters, carrying a basket of cookies.  She sets them down by Frasier._

speaker: Roz
text: No, I haven't.  I've been looking for him myself.

speaker: Roz
text: Stop that, they're for him!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_frustrated_] Do you really think he had anything to do with... _Bulldog walks by outside the booth, followed by a large group of people._

speaker: Roz
text: There he is!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_from outside; whistles_] Hey, hey, hey!  Nothing new here. [_entering book, pushing his cart_] I take my pants off one leg at a time, just like everybody else.  You can vouch for that, can't you, Myrna?

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Bulldog, I made these cookies for you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_slaps stomach_] Wow, I already had a bunch of muffins, but... there's always room for a cookie. [_takes bite_] Um, where's the milk?

speaker: Roz
text: [_running out_] Ooh, coming right up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, doc!  This hero stuff is the best!  Hey, last night, sisters.  At one point, I was a hero sandwich! [_snickers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Just drop it.  I saw what you did yesterday. [_standing_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_sniggering_] Yeah, I saved your butt.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] Saved my butt, my ass!  You pulled Roz in front of you to protect yourself!  Everything else that happened was simply by accident.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_yelling, pointing_] THAT STINKS!  THAT'S TOTAL BS!  I'm a hero!  I'm a brave, brave man! [_lowers voice_] Aw, Jeez, you're not gonna tell, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me one good reason why I shouldn't.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You like muffins?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, I was determined to expose you, but it suddenly occurs to me I don't have to.  You'll do it yourself.  And you know why?  Because a guilty conscience needs no accuser. [_turns away_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_hopefully_] That means you won't tell?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turns back, shaking finger_] Once again, I don't have to, because a guilty conscience sleeps in thunder!

speaker: Frasier
text: It means I won't tell.

speaker: Producer
text: [_v.o._] Twenty seconds, Bulldog.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, actually I'll be fascinated as a psychiatrist to watch this little experiment.  I know that deep down you feel bad about what you've done.  And you'll feel worse every time you capitalize on it.  How long before your conscience finally overwhelms you?

speaker: Producer
text: You're on.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_on air_] Hey, sports fans!  This is Bob Bulldog Briscoe, and you're in the doghouse! [_honks horn, barks_] Let's go to the phones!

speaker: Roz
text: [_on air, from inside producer's booth_] Hey, everybody, this is Roz Doyle, and I have some very exciting news!  Each year, at the SeaBea Awards, one radio personality receives the Harold Hirschauer Man of the Year Award... _Bulldog looks distinctly nervous.  Frasier watches him with an "I knew it" expression on his face._

speaker: Roz
text: ...and this year, our winner is our very own Bulldog Briscoe, who was chosen for his heroism!  Congratulations, Bulldog!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you say to that, hero?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_into mike_] Well, this is incredible.  I.. I uh really feel honored....

speaker: Bulldog
text: But I gotta clear something up.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yesterday, at the cafe, this young lady kept coming up to me saying, "You're my hero.  How can I ever thank you?"  Well, I've got a confession to make. [_glances at Frasier_] [_grins_] I lost your number, but if you call in, baby, I've got an answer for you! _Frasier walks out, indignant.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One - Int. Frasier's Living Room at the Elliot Bay Towers. Niles sits on Frasier's couch while Daphne stands behind Martin's chair._

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, I'm ready.  Go ahead, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: And the SeaBea goes to... [_Niles looks anxious_] Doctor Niles Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  Oh! _He walks over to Daphne, who is standing with a garish statuette of Frasier's._

speaker: Daphne
text: Congratulations! [_hands him statue_]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you!  You know, to be accurate, it's traditional for the presenter to kiss and embrace the winner.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_confused_] But won't your brother be the presenter?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we can't know that for certain.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nods_] Oh.  All right, then. [_kisses and hugs him_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_pulling away from Niles_] Hello, Doctor Crane!  We're just practicing for Saturday night.  Best-case scenario.

speaker: Frasier
text: Obviously.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Daph, your pie's done.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thanks. [_to Frasier_] Will you be joining us for coffee and dessert?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no thank you, Daphne.  I'm not very hungry.

speaker: Niles
text: Where've you been?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I've been driving around, thinking.  I can't seem to get this Bulldog thing off my mind.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting, pouring coffee_] Well, don't worry about it.  We all get obsessed sometimes.  The important thing is to drop it before you start yakking on and on to someone who doesn't give a rat's ass.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glaring_] Is that your roundabout way of saying you don't want to discuss it?

speaker: Martin
text: You wanna take the direct route?

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting at table_] Why do you care so much about Bulldog?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not really Bulldog, so much.  It's just that I believe that conscience, more than customs and laws, is what prevents people from doing wrong.  To contemplate the idea of an otherwise sane man with no conscience... [_sigh_] It just shakes my entire world view.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_placing food on table_] Well, in our family, we certainly knew the meaning of conscience.  That's what my dad called his wooden paddle.

speaker: Niles
text: [_grimacing, horrified_] Oh, how awful for you!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_matter-of-factly, smiling_] Oh, for my brothers, yes.  But I knew he'd never use it on me, as long as I was always good. [_smile fades_] As long as I was always polite. [_looks disturbed_] As long as I always had a smile on my face no matter how I felt inside! [_slams down the silverware in front of them_] As long as I was always ready to wait on all the men, hand and foot, day and night, year in, year out!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_brightly_] More coffee, anyone?

speaker: Niles
text: [_standing_] No, no, no, you just have a seat. [_gestures for her to sit at the table, lifts coffee pot, begins to pour_] You... just... here, I'll... for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe I'm blowing this thing out of proportion.  I just can't understand how Bulldog can accept all those accolades and not be tormented by it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, maybe he is.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, for all you know, he's at home right now, pacing the floor, unable to sleep.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nods_] Well, that's a comforting thought, Niles. [_pause_] But we'll never know for sure, now, will we? [_pause_] Well, enough about this.  You know, I think I'm off to bed.  Goodnight all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodnight!

speaker: Martin
text: Goodnight, son. [_to Daphne and Niles_] You know, I'm really proud of Fras.  Used to be he'd get a bee in his bonnet, and he'd never get it out.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I thought we'd be hearing about this one for weeks.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the old Frasier'd be up with this all night.

speaker: Martin
text: Exactly!  Wouldn't be able to sleep until he went over to Bulldog's to make sure he wasn't sleeping.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_lifting milk to pour into coffee_] I should have told him to pick up some more milk. _Niles and Martin nod in agreement.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Int. hallway outside of Bulldog's apartment. Frasier walks in, looking for Bulldog's apartment number.  He finds it and knocks loudly repeatedly._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_o.s._] Okay, okay. [_opens door; wearing a robe_] What're you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I want to talk to you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ugh.  This isn't a good time.  I got company.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] You have done something horrible, and selfish. And I need to know that you feel bad about it.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What, you've been looking through the keyhole?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm talking about what happened with Roz!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Aw, not this again.

speaker: Woman 1
text: : [_o.s._] Bulldog, I'm lonely.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Talk to your sister for a sec, I'll be right there.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ooh, man, I gotta go.  See ya _ma�ana._ [_slams door_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog! [_holds buzzer down_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_opens door_] Would you stop that?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not leaving until I know that you feel some remorse for what you've done.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wow, this is really bugging you, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well.  Okay.  All right, all right.  The truth?  The truth is I feel bad. [_hangs his head_] I feel real bad. [_pretends to cry_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_horrified_] You feel NOTHING!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm sorry, doc!  These little things just don't get to me!

speaker: Frasier
text: The little thing in question is using a pregnant woman as a human shield!  Have you no conscience?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_hands on hips_] Well, maybe I don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: I refuse to believe that!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, maybe it was something I was born without... like, oh, like my cousin.  He was born without a big toe on each foot. I used to sneak up on him and tip him over. [_pause_] I didn't feel bad about that, either. [_turns to go inside_] See ya, doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reaching for him_] No!  No!  No, you don't!  I know you've got a conscience.  It must be buried deep inside there.  I will find a way to get it out of you!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, you do that, doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you mark my words.  I don't know how yet, but come Saturday night you will be so consumed with guilt you will not be able to accept that Man of the Year Award! [_stalks off_] **AND THE WEINER IS...** _Scene Three - Int. Reception Hall where the SeaBeas are being held. Frasier spots Martin and Daphne coming down the stairs._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_waves_] Daphne! _She waves and walks down with Martin to join him, holding her arms out to hug him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're gorgeous.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_smiling_] Oh, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, not bad, either! [_pats his back_]

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, although I guess any guy looks good in a monkey suit.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] On the drive over I started musing about why they call it a monkey suit.  I had quite a few theories on that one.

speaker: Martin
text: [_grins_] Oh, she sure did. [_whispering to Frasier_] Can I get a ride home with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course. _Roz walks up in the garish silver dress.  The huge bow is in the front.  Her hair is a mound of curls on top of her head._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Roz, is everything all right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I'm fine, it's just that my hair is huge and this dress is a joke.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, nonsense, Roz, you look divine.

speaker: Roz
text: No, I look LIKE Divine.  I gotta go sit down. [_moves toward table, then looks at herself_] Oh, my God.  Look at the way the lights are shining on the sequins on this dress!  I'm a disco ball! [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it certainly promises to be quite a night.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  You know, I'm glad to see you're enjoying yourself. I wasn't sure that you would, what with Bulldog getting that award and everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_conspiratorially_] Well, Dad, I wouldn't be surprised if Bulldog actually declines that award.

speaker: Martin
text: Why would he?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've arranged a few surprises to prick his conscience, until, like Hamlet's stepfather, he totters from the banquet, ghostly pale and gibbering with guilt!

speaker: Martin
text: [_turning around and whispering to stranger_] Can I get a ride home with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all. [_stops in front of Daphne_] Daphne, you look stunning.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_smiles_] Oh, thanks, you look very smart.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  Of course, I guess it's hard not to look elegant in evening wear.

speaker: Niles
text: Hard but not impossible.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  Well, shall we take our seats?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  Although if Dame Rumor is correct, I won't be sitting long!  Now are we all at table... [_looks at card_] 105?

speaker: Daphne
text: We're at table four.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me. [_goes to a stewardess_] Where's this table?

speaker: Waitress
text: One hundred five... that's the technical awards.  Just go down to the basement, cross through the kitchen to the hall, and ask for the Napoleon Room.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, the Napoleon Room, that sounds charming.

speaker: Waitress
text: We call it that because the ceilings are so low.

speaker: Daphne
text: What a shame.  Now you won't get to see your brother host or hear all the little jokes he's written....

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Daphne, I needed some cheering up. _They continue to laugh as they walk away, Niles to go downstairs, Daphne and Martin to sit at table four.  Frasier glares.  Bulldog approaches with a blonde woman._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to his date_] Aw, Jeez, let's go this way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, there's no reason to avoid me, Bulldog.  I have no intention of ruining your evening.  In fact, I've gone to great lengths to make it memorable.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Eh, you been sleeping okay, doc?  You look a little tired.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't you worry about me, I'll sleep fine tonight!  The sleep of the just!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Me, too.  The sleep of the just boinked. [_hits Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: And the nominees are: "Consumer Forum," Wendy Hashiro, talent, Mike Friedman, producer [_applause_]; "The Doctor Frasier Crane Show," Dr. Frasier Crane, talent, Roz Doyle, producer [_gestures to Roz; applause; Daphne grins brightly_]; and "Bob and Nipsy's Morning Laugh Factory," Bob and Nipsy, talent, Lunatic Larry, producer [_applause_].  And the SeaBea goes to... [_opens envelope_] Well, well.  "Bob and Nipsy's Morning Laugh Factory!" [_music; applause_] Bob and Nipsy couldn't make it tonight, so [_takes SeaBea, pats it_] I accept this award on their behalf.  That brings us to our final category, but rather than compete with the coffee service, let's take a short break, and we'll be right back with... the Man of the Year Award!

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry you didn't win.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_brightly_] Oh, God, that's all right, Dad!  I'm only concerned about one award tonight.  That's the next one!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Doctor Crane!  How did it go?

speaker: Niles
text: [_false cheer_] I lost!

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry you didn't win.  God, I've been saying that a lot tonight. [_pours wine_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look, wine.  They didn't serve alcohol at the technical awards, as I informed so many of the guests who mistook me for their waiter.  You see, I was the only nominee dressed in black tie, except for the one man in front wearing a tuxedo tee-shirt.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: At least I didn't come home empty-handed.  We each received one of these handsome certificates [_hands it to Roz_], which were given out after we'd folded our tables and stacked our chairs. _Niles sits, music plays.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Four - Reception Hall. Sometime later, Frasier continues with the awards._

speaker: Frasier
text: Welcome back, ladies and gentlemen.  Now the time has come to present the Harold Hirschauer Man of the Year Award. [_Susan places award on table_] Thank you, Susan.  As you all know, this award is presented every year to the radio personality who brings _honor_ to our medium.  This year, that person is Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe!  C'mon up here, Bulldog! [_applause_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_runs up to front_] [_into microphone_] Wow, what a night, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes Bulldog's shoulders and shakes him "affectionately"_] Well, Bob, the night is just beginning for you.  Could we please lower the house lights?

speaker: Bulldog
text: What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_arm around Bulldog's shoulders_] Just a few surprise guests that I've invited to help you celebrate this evening! [_pats him_] People from your past that've helped make you the man you are today.  Do you recognize... this voice?

speaker: O'Rourke
text: Bobby Briscoe, you've made us all proud.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_looks around_] Oh my gosh, is that-

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's Father O'Rourke, your boyhood priest and childhood confessor! [_applause_] And who's that next to him?

speaker: McCloud
text: Bobby Briscoe, sit down in your chair! _Bulldog holds a hand up over his eyes as if to get a better look at who's talking._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right, it's Mrs. McCloud, your second-grade teacher! [_she waves_] The woman who taught you that _honesty_ is the best policy! [_applause_] And who's that next to her?

speaker: Nugent
text: Drop and give me fifty, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_pointing, excited_] Oh, my gosh, Coach Nugents!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Coach Nugent, from your peewee football days, the man who taught you that it doesn't matter whether you win or lose but that you play the game fair!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_covers mike_] You're wasting your time.

speaker: Frasier
text: And who's that next to him?  Yes!  It's the president... of your fan club!  Little Joey Katona, whose only dream is to grow up and be just like you! [_applause, Joey, grinning, squeaks Bulldog-esque horn_] But we're not through yet!  Could we please bring the house lights up again?

speaker: Frasier
text: We've saved the best for last.  It's the woman that gave everything to you...

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_into mike_] Well, you'll have to narrow that one down!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rolls eyes_] The night would not be complete without the woman who taught you right from wrong.... It's your mother, Bernice Briscoe! [_backs away from Bulldog, clapping with rest of audience_] _A short, stout woman in a floral print dress walks in from backstage._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Mom!

speaker: Bernice
text: I am so proud of you, Bobby!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, Ma!!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now let's turn the microphone over to our guest of honor this evening.  I'm sure we're all anxious to see [_very tense with anticipation_] what the hero has to say!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_goes up to mike_] I'm really blown away by all this. [_pause_] I didn't think I'd be accepting this in front of all you guys. [_pulls speech out of inside coat pocket_] I wrote up this little speech. [_balls it up_] I can't say this stuff now. [_seems to feel guilty_] What I've got to say is simple.... [_long pause, Frasier smiles; finally, Bulldog grabs SeaBea_] This is totally awesome!  Thank you everybody! _Frasier seems blown away himself.  Martin, across from him, shakes his head.  Daphne frowns, as does Niles.  Bulldog walks over to his mom and starts back toward his seat with her._

speaker: Frasier
text: This can't be happening!

speaker: Martin
text: Let it go.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't!  The man is a coward and he's being rewarded!

speaker: Martin
text: Guess I'm never gonna hear the end of this, now, am I?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  I'm sorry, Dad, but I won't-

speaker: Martin
text: [_interrupting_] All right, all right, wait just a minute. [_beat; whispering to Bulldog, as he passes with his mom_] Hey, Bulldog, there's a guy right there with a gun! [_points_] _Bulldog grabs his mother, pushes her in front of him, and ducks behind her, using her as a shield._

speaker: Bulldog
text: There's a gun!

speaker: Martin
text: [_loudly_] Sorry, my mistake.

speaker: Waitress
text: He used his own mother to protect himself!

speaker: Date
text: Eeeeew!

speaker: Roz
text: Isn't that what you did to me?

speaker: Bulldog
text: No!  I just, uh.... no, no!

speaker: Bernice
text: What is the matter with you? [_starts hitting him in the head_]

speaker: O'Rourke
text: [_standing_] You don't deserve that award! _Uproar.  Various people yell at Bulldog as Roz and Mrs. Briscoe take turns hitting him._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smiling_] Thanks, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_grins_] Hey, I'm no hero, I just wanted you to shut up.  FADE OUT
